subdisciplines.name: Queer Theory
subdisciplines.description: A field of critical theory that emerged in the late 1980s from feminist studies and LGBTQ+ studies, questioning the binary categories that inform gender and sexuality, and exploring the ways in which power structures shape individuals and societies.

subdisciplines.name: Transgender Studies
subdisciplines.description: An interdisciplinary field that explores gender identity and expression, as experienced by transgender, transsexual, and gender non-binary people.

subdisciplines.name: LGBTQ+ History
subdisciplines.description: The study of LGBTQ+ people and their experiences throughout history.

subdisciplines.name: LGBTQ+ Psychology
subdisciplines.description: The study of psychological phenomena related to LGBTQ+ identities, such as coming out, identity development, and mental health disparities.

subdisciplines.name: LGBTQ+ Sociology
subdisciplines.description: The study of social phenomena related to LGBTQ+ identities, such as social movements, discrimination, and community building.
